name: Riesling Snapper
author: Clement
summary: The wine evaporated before cooking the fish gives it a very particular caramelized wine taste and doesn't need any sauce with it. Goes very well with any vegetable and will impress your guests by its subtlety (still being very fast and easy to prepare).
ingredients: 3 ounces butter, cut into small pieces
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Pour Riesling wine into a large skillet over medium heat; cook until mostly evaporated, 5 to 7 minutes
Stir butter and garlic into remaining wine; cook and stir until the garlic softens and the butter melts completely, 3 to 5 minutes
Season red snapper fillets with salt and black pepper
Increase heat under the skillet to high; gently lie snapper fillets into the butter and garlic mixture
Cook about 3 minutes, turn, add the almonds, and continue cooking until the flesh of the snapper flakes easily with a fork, 2 to 3 minutes more
